list_definition.definition: a public usually written announcement of policies and intentions, especially by a political party

list_ex_of_english: Even in those days manifestos were not widely read documents.
The details of proposed legislation are not always so explicit in manifestos.
They know that more elections mean more selections, more candidates, more manifestos, more parties, more party politics and, indeed, less independence.
The structure for such government is, as we know, in line with their manifestos.
We all proclaim, in our election manifestoes and party literature, that we are for modernisation.
I believe that, whatever attachment people have to party manifestos, in this case that devotion would be misplaced.
How can it be shown that the implication that voters have given a verdict on manifestos is actually correct?
The left hand, perhaps, is negotiating fundamentally, in good faith, upon the terms set out in the election manifestos.
